definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: If I have to not give up, you will not accompany me until the heavens down.
sentences.chinese: 如果我一直堅持不放棄，你會不會陪我撐到天塌下去。

sentences.english: "The sky is falling and I must go and tell the King, "said Henny Penny.
sentences.chinese: “天要塌下來了我必須得去告訴國王，”小雞潘妮說。

sentences.english: We know that our sky might fall at any moment.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道，我們的自己的“天”隨時可能塌下來。

sentences.english: The shelf is beginning to yield under that heavy weight.
sentences.chinese: 架子受不了那重量，開始塌下去了。

sentences.english: If I'm not beaten by myself, I'm not afraid of a broken world.
sentences.chinese: 只要不被自己打敗，又何懼世界塌下來。

sentences.english: Sometimes I would fall down just by tripping.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，我會塌下來了剛剛由跳閘。

sentences.english: If the day collapses down, perhaps how many stars can pick?
sentences.chinese: 如果天塌下來，說不定可以撿到幾顆星星？

sentences.english: It rained like the skies were falling.
sentences.chinese: 雨下得就像天要塌下來似的。

sentences.english: I lay down on the floor. I was scared things would collapse.
sentences.chinese: 我躺在地上，害怕東西會塌下來。

sentences.english: The roof of the old house caved in.
sentences.chinese: 那棟舊房子的屋頂塌下了。

sentences.english: These monster images are copyrighted so you will need to desing similar ones to those (can be very similar, same doddle style).
sentences.chinese: 在影像中可以看到怪獸就要塌下來在屏幕上。

sentences.english: Let justice finished, though heaven fall.
sentences.chinese: 縱然天塌下來也要伸張正義。

sentences.english: Let justice be done, though sky falls.
sentences.chinese: 即使天塌下來，也要做到公平。

sentences.english: I had been at Chrysler less than three months when all hell break loose .
sentences.chinese: 我到克萊斯勤公司還不到三個月，天就象是要塌下來。

sentences.english: " The sky is falling, " says Deer.

definition: to collapse (of building, dam or bridge)
to collapse/to crash down/to fall down in a heap
the earth quaked, the mountains shook (idiom); a tremendous battle
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
talus slide/to crumble (of scree slope)/to collapse/landslide
subsidence/caving in/fig. stranded/lost (in contemplation, daydreams etc)
